abstract: An experimental circuit breaker for stock markets, put in place after last month’s flash crash, kicked in for the second time on Tuesday, after a sudden plunge in the price of Citigroup shares, leaving industry observers feeling optimistic about the new mechanism.
snippet: An experimental circuit breaker for stock markets, put in place after last month’s flash crash, kicked in for the second time on Tuesday, after a sudden plunge in the price of Citigroup shares, leaving industry observers feeling optimistic about t...
lead_paragraph: An experimental circuit breaker for stock markets that was put in place after last month’s so-called flash crash kicked in for the second time on Tuesday after an erroneous trade caused a sudden plunge in the price of Citigroup shares, leaving industry observers feeling optimistic about the new mechanism.

abstract: Fears that the global economy will worsen gripped the financial markets again Tuesday, with downbeat economic news that investors might have shrugged off in calmer times sending the broad stock market tumbling to its lowest level this year.
snippet: Fears that the global economy will worsen gripped the financial markets again Tuesday, with downbeat economic news that investors might have shrugged off in calmer times sending the broad stock market tumbling to its lowest level this year.
lead_paragraph: This looks like a long, hot summer for Wall Street.

headline.main: U.S. Stocks Drop on New Jitters About Global Growth

abstract: The aircraft maker will buy Argon ST to expand its capabilities in warfare and intelligence gathering.
snippet: The aircraft maker will buy Argon ST to expand its capabilities in warfare and intelligence gathering.
lead_paragraph: Boeing said Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire a combat engineering company, Argon ST, for about $775 million in a deal to expand its capabilities in intelligence gathering and warfare, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Boeing to Buy Defense Company for $775 Million

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co

abstract: The World Trade Organization ruled that European government subsidies gave the European aircraft maker an unfair advantage over Boeing.
snippet: The World Trade Organization ruled that European government subsidies gave the European aircraft maker an unfair advantage over Boeing.
lead_paragraph: The United States won an “important victory” in a trade ruling that Airbus, the European plane maker, had benefited from four decades of improper subsidies, taking sales from Boeing as a result, the United States trade representative, Ron Kirk, said on Wednesday.

headline.main: In Ruling, W.T.O. Faults Europe Over Aid to Airbus
headline.print_headline: In Ruling, W.T.O. Faults Europe Over Aid to Airbus
